venue.address_1: 460C Harrison Ave Boston, MA 02118. Our GPS address is 365 Albany Street, Boston MA 02118
venue.name: SOWA Vinatge Market

item.description:
STYLING WITH VINTAGE:

BOSTON'S ARBITERS OF STYLE TELL YOU HOW

BE INSPIRED BY TRUE VINTAGE IN A WORLD WHERE

EVERYTHING SEEMS "VINTAGE INSPIRED"


 Join us at SoWa Vintage Market for a truly special event! On January 30th, some of Boston's leading style experts will give you their prespective on the utilization of vintage in their craft and will take your questions. Never before has a team of experts been assembled in Boston to explore all aspects of styling with vintage in the perfect place to source vintage, SoWa Vintage Market. Managed and created by Stephanie Pernice and John Warren, the market features fresh vintage and designer finds from 30 different dealers each week. This cool urban vintage flea market is situated in the SoWa arts and media district in Boston’s South End. Join us at SoWa Vintage Market for mid century modern, industrial, French, Swedish, Italian, Danish decor, and urban chic pieces for home and beyond. The vintage fashion, jelewry, and accessory vendors at SoWa Vintage Market bring the most amazing pieces each week making this a "must shop" for every fashion addict looking to find incredible men's and women's vintage.

https://www.facebook.com/SoWaVintageMarket?fref=ts


WHO: Bobby Garnett of Bobby From Boston

WHY: A Hollywood costumer for decades, he is the entertainment industry's number one source for vintage wardrobe needs.

If you have ever watched a television show or seen a movie, you have experienced what Bobby and his team contribute to wardrobe production!

A small sampling of his of work include: HBO's "Boardwalk Empire", 60's costuming for "MIB 3", Period wardrobe for "Seabuiscuit", "Good Fellas" and "Casino".

WHAT: We are thrilled to have Bobby talk about his vast  experience with vintage fashion and his work as a costumer for television and film production.

 

 

 

 

 


 

WHO: Doreen Dove, founder & chief stylist of

The Organized Wardrobe.

WHY: Doreen helps her clients develop their own sense of style, while maximizing the investment they have already made in their wardrobe. She believes that personal style is just that: personal and unique to each individual. Doreen is a certified “Style for Hire” Stylist by fashion expert Stacy London of TLC’s What Not To Wear”.

WHAT: Doreen will show us how to bump up your style using vintage fashion, jewelry, and accessories found at SoWa Vintage Market.


 

 

 

 

WHO: Mike Diskin- Pop culture/lifestyle reporter, photographer.

http://www.mikediskin.com/

WHY: As the former creative director of The Phoenix Media/Communications Group (an historic and culturally significant Boston-based media company that owns The Boston Phoenix, WFNX Radio, and STUFF Magazine), Mike has spent the past two decades building a successful career in the worlds of fashion, food, travel, and pop-cultural coverage. With his roots in print design, a natural eye for photography, and plenty of experience producing high-end commercial and editorial projects, Mike is often asked to be involved creatively in situations from concept to completion.

He’s worked with Top Chef’s on the opening of their new restaurants. He’s photographed some of the most beautiful people and places in the world. And he regularly contributes to local publications, radio shows and television programming as a lifestyle/trends reporter. Recent clients include: W Hotels, Sandals Resorts, Langham Hotels, Macy’s, Herb Chambers Motors, Niche Media, Nantucket Magazine, Cox Media Group, Longwood Events, and Beth Israel Deaconess Hospital.

WHAT: Mike will talk about his experiences as a pop culture photographer and his views on the role vintage plays for style kings and queens. Mike will have his camera with him to capture all the vintage fashion magic and fans in attendance at this SoWa Vintage Market Meetup.

 

 

 

WHO: Erica Farthing- Event designer

www.assemblyboston.com

WHY: Erica Farthing is the owner of Assembly, a Boston-based design and production company specializing in high-end events and restaurant development.

Erica's client list includes names like MTV, Ford, and Dewar’s. Her most recent project was overseeing the creation of Lincoln Tavern & Restaurant in South Boston. www.lincolnsouthboston.com

WHAT: Erica will create  a "Designer Vignette" using elements found at SoWa Vintage Market and talk about how she uses vintage to add individual style in all of her design work.
item.name: STYLING WITH VINTAGE: BOSTON'S ARBITERS OF STYLE TELL YOU HOW
